page.title: 04Ayr Cattle Market.
page.content: Ayr market has been on its present site for almost 100 years and, in spite of a need to expand, will remain so due to the prohibitive cost of rebuilding. The market, which serves most of South West Scotland has become one of the largest{fatstock markets}in the country with a throughput of about 90000 cattle, 14000 calves and 130000 sheep per year. In the past Ayr dealt mainly with dairy cattle but in recent years the trend has been towards beef. Ayr market is growing steadily and surveys show larger markets like Ayr continuing to grow while markets in smaller towns are disappearing. With approximately 2000 people coming into town on each of the two market days each week a great deal of trade is brought to Ayr which in turn plays an important part in the town's prosperity.
